noun.description: The rise and fall of the voice in speaking.
examples: she spoke English with a German intonation

noun.description: Accuracy of pitch in playing or singing, or on a stringed instrument such as a guitar.
examples: poor woodwind intonation at the opening

noun.description: The opening phrase of a plainsong melody.

origin: Early 17th century (in intonation (sense 3)): from medieval Latin intonatio(n-), from intonare (see intone).
